description_txt: stated on February 12, 2013 in GOP response to Obama's State of the Union:
quote_txt: "I still live in the same working-class neighborhood I grew up in."

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2013 in the State of the Union address:
quote_txt: "We have doubled the distance our cars will go on a gallon of gas."

description_txt: stated on February 2, 2013 in a campaign rally:
quote_txt: "We have a governor who's vetoed measures like increasing our minimum wage and restoring the earned income tax cut."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2013 in an editorial.:
quote_txt: Says Texas ranks first among the states in the amount of carbon dioxide emitted and toxic chemicals released into water.

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2013 in the State of the Union Address:
quote_txt: "Throughout, we have kept Congress fully informed of our efforts" to create a legal framework on counterterrorism.

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2013 in an editorial.:
quote_txt: Says Texas has the nation’s most uninsured residents.

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2013 in a speech to Ohio College Democrats.:
quote_txt: Says he was the first local official to endorse Barack Obama

description_txt: stated on January 22, 2013 in interviews:
quote_txt: On his definition of "takers" and "makers"

description_txt: stated on February 5, 2013 in newspaper column:
quote_txt: "I was never against same-sex marriage."

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2013 in the State of the Union Address:
quote_txt: Says "overwhelming majorities of Americans" support gun legislation "like background checks."

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2013 in the Republican response to the State of the Union:
quote_txt: Military spending cuts, known as the sequester, were President Barack Obama’s idea.

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2013 in the State of the Union Address:
quote_txt: Says his administration has made "progress" on border enforcement by "putting more boots on the southern border than at any time in our history and reducing illegal crossings to their lowest levels in 40 years."

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2013 in the Republican response to the State of the Union Address:
quote_txt: "Our economy actually shrank during the last three months of 2012."

description_txt: stated on February 12, 2013 in the State of the Union Address:
quote_txt: "After shedding jobs for more than 10 years, our manufacturers have added about 500,000 jobs over the past three."

description_txt: stated on January 22, 2013 in a Texas Tribune interview.:
quote_txt: Says abortions are decreasing.

description_txt: stated on January 7, 2013 in a chart:
quote_txt: State support for local schools per pupil has decreased by at least 25 percent over the past decade.

description_txt: stated on February 7, 2013 in a press call :
quote_txt: Says, "Since 1994 when VAWA was first passed, incidents of domestic violence have dropped more than 50 percent."

description_txt: stated on January 31, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: "When the Affordable Care Act was signed, 17 million American children" had a pre-existing condition and were "uninsurable."

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2013 in a news release:
quote_txt: "Three in four low-income workers don’t have any paid sick days available."

description_txt: stated on January 15, 2013 in a news conference.:
quote_txt: Except for Virginia, "the other 49 states keep raising their gas tax."

description_txt: stated on February 4, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: There are twice as many gun shops as McDonald’s in the United States.

description_txt: stated on January 29, 2013 in his State of the State address.:
quote_txt: Says Texas high school "graduation rates are at an all-time high—the third-highest in the nation—which represents a significant turnaround from just a few short years ago."

description_txt: stated on January 23, 2013 in comments on his MSNBC show:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Sen. Ron Johnson, R-Wisconsin, was elected in a "very low turnout" race.

description_txt: stated on February 1, 2013 in a panel discussion on HBO’s “Real Time with Bill Maher”:
quote_txt: Says "right now, we have more military spending than the next 10, 11, 12 countries combined."

description_txt: stated on January 26, 2013 in a speech:
quote_txt: More than 40 percent of sales nationally are made without background checks.

description_txt: stated on February 5, 2013:
quote_txt: Says Austin trains are "full" at rush hour and "packed" for special events.

description_txt: stated on February 5, 2013 in a House hearing on immigration:
quote_txt: "With the exception of slavery and the Chinese Exclusion Act, our laws have never barred persons from becoming citizens."

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2013 in an editorial:
quote_txt: Says Texas is "last in mental health expenditures."

description_txt: stated on January 9, 2013 in a speech.:
quote_txt: "The brutal fact is, when it comes to education, America is slipping" behind other nations.

description_txt: stated on February 6, 2013 in an editorial.:
quote_txt: Says Texas ranks first in executions among the states.
